name: A Quiz of No Importance | Musicals | 10 Questions

questions.text: Lynn Ahrens and Stephen Flaherty were the lyricist and composer respectively, but who wrote the book to the musical?
questions.explanation:
Terrence McNally.

	McNally also wrote the books for "Ragtime" and " Frankie and Johnny in the Clair de Lune", as well as the book for "The Full Monty". He was born in 1938 in Florida. "Ragtime" ran from January 18, 1998 to January 16, 2000.  "Frankie and Johnny in the Clair de Lune" ran from August 8th, 2002 to March 9th, 2003. "The Full Monty" ran from October 26, 2000 to September 1, 2002.

questions.text: At which theater did "A Man of No Importance" play?
questions.explanation:
Mitzi E. Newhouse Theater

	The Mitzi E. Newhouse Theater can be found on West 65th Street and seats 299 people. Other shows that have played there include "Elegies" and "Third". "Elegies" ran from March 2, 2003 to March 30, 2003 and "Third" ran from October 24, 2005 to December 18, 2005.

Roger Rees.

	Roger Rees played Alfie Byrne, the main character in the musical. The musical is based on the movie of the same name, which starred Albert Finney.

questions.text: Alfie and his troupe of amateur actors stage their shows in this church:
questions.explanation:
St. Imelda's

	Alfie's day job is driving buses, but his passion lies in the theatre, where he and his acting company are putting on a production of Oscar Wilde's "Salome". As the play is onsidered too risque for 1960's Dublin, the group faces many challenges.

True.

	Alfie does indeed live with his sister Lily in their apartment. She claims that he needs someone to look after him and cook for him, but it's Alfie who does the cooking!

questions.text: Who is Lily planning on marrying?
questions.explanation:
Carney.

	She is putting off the marriage to make sure Alfie is taken care of. Carney is part of Alfie's acting company and is a butcher by day. He begins to have reservations about the group's production of "Salome".

Roscommon.

	Adele is the woman who Alfie picks to portray Salome. She is new to Dublin and is an unwed mother. Roscommon is a town and a name of a county in Ireland that even has its own castle!

questions.text: Which character sings "The Cuddles Mary Gave"?
questions.explanation:
Baldy.

	Baldy is the stage manager for the acting company. He suggests Alfie settle down and find a woman as he remembers his happy life with his late wife Mary.

questions.text: Who is Robbie in love with?
questions.explanation:
Mrs. Patrick

	Alfie is in love with Robbie, who in turn is in love with Mrs. Patrick, a mother of three. She does not return his love, and sees their affair as something pleasant with which to pass the time.

Why.

	"Tell Me Why" is sung by Lily when Alfie reveals to her that he is gay. He should've known that she would love him no matter what, even if he is gay and despite the fact that she doesn't really support his amateur theatre ambitions.
